The trend was occurring, according to the agency, because of stolen customer information obtained through phishing websites “disguised as websites of real securities companies” Japan has increasingly warned its citizens of cyberattacks targeting the country from China.

title: Preparing For The Quantum Leap - New Technology - United Kingdom - Mondaq
summary: In March 2023, the UK announced a £2.5bn investment in quantum technologies. Over £100m of government funding was announced to support five new tech hubs which aim to develop practical uses of quantum technology. Big tech giants are jumping into the fray, with Microsoft recently announcing its creation of the world's first quantum processor. While quantum computing may seem like the stuff of science fiction, its impact will be felt cross-industry and will likely bring about significant opportunities as well as challenges.

title: Sustained demand key to long-term cyber re/insurance market growth: Gallagher Re
summary: Sustained demand key to long-term cyber re/insurance market growth: Gallagher Re. Reinsurance broker emphasised that ensuring sustainable growth in the cyber insurance market is not just about capital and capacity, but also about increasing demand. A key driver of demand is ensuring that insureds view cyber coverage as a necessary investment for managing risk, rather than an optional cost. Gallagher Re urges underwriters to prepare during this softer cycle to gain stakeholder trust and demonstrate that leaning into a hard market is a viable strategy.

title: The Cyber War on Democracy: Lessons from the 2024 RNC Email Hack | Tripwire
summary: Chinese hackers infiltrated the Republican National Committee (RNC) email system in 2024. Attackers maintained access for several months, trying to get their hands on intelligence on how the GOP planned to address Taiwan in its party platform. RNC leadership, including Trump campaign co-chair Chris LaCivita, chose not to inform the FBI, fearing leaks in the media. The RNC incident highlights that if we want to protect democracy, urgent intervention in the form of stronger cybersecurity measures is critical. The breach is part of an insidious and troubling rise in subversion.

title: AI and the New Face of War: How Artificial Intelligence Is Rewriting Every Phase of Conflict
summary: Artificial Intelligence is reshaping how wars begin, unfold, and end in the age of hybrid warfare. Modern warfare has evolved into a complex domain known as Hybrid Warfare, blending conventional combat with cyber strategies, psychological manipulation, and economic coercion. In open warfare, AI becomes a battlefield actor, enhancing agility, speed, and precision across all military levels. In Iraq, AI was used to map destruction and prioritize rebuilding after ISIS. China leverages AI-powered media to craft favorable post-conflict narratives. Hamas uses deepfakes and disinformation to garner global sympathy and reinforce its influence.

title: Teach young people about ransomware risks before they enter work, expert urges
summary: Matt Cooke, cybersecurity strategist at digital security firm Proofpoint, said more can be done to prepare people to deal with a cyber threat. Attacks such as ransomware often start with the targeting of individuals, he said. Cooke: 'We need to get to that level of understanding for people as they’re coming into the workforce' He welcomed proposals from ministers earlier this year which could see public sector firms and national infrastructure bodies banned from making ransomware payments. The Government and intelligence services are talking more publicly about the threats around cybersecurity, Cooke said.

title: The Cyber Governance Code: Restarting and reinforcing resilience conversations in ...
summary: The UK’s National Cyber Security Centre recently published its Cyber Governance Code of Practice. The Code aims to provide a framework for effectively governing cyber security risks. It sets out a series of actions across five key areas including risk management, people and strategy. For those supporting governance structures and / or reporting to boards and committees, reading the Code is essential preparation. For financial services, the operational resilience regime continues to set the regulatory standard for cyber governance. There will likely be more scrutiny once the FCA and other regulators finalise their operational incident reporting regimes. This is a good opportunity to refocus the conversation on cyber resilience.

title: FBI Las Vegas warns all small business owners to protect themselves from cyber criminals
summary: FBI Las Vegas warns all small business owners to protect themselves from cyber criminals. Scammers ask for payments ranging from $75 to thousands of dollars, or restaurants will be bombarded with fake one or two-star reviews on various platforms. The reviews will continue until the victimized business complies with the scammers’ demands. The FBI’s Las Vegas Division explains why small businesses have become the latest target of these scammers, who could come from organized networks or even individuals in prison.

title: 85% of CEOs say cybersecurity is critical for business growth - DIGIT
summary: 85% of CEOs say cybersecurity is critical for business growth. 61% are concerned about cybersecurity threats, driven in large part by artificial intelligence’s growing role in commercial activity. 87% of security professionals report that their organisation has encountered an AI-driven cyber-attack within the last year. Chief information security offices (CISOs) themselves have said that AI-powered threats are having a significant impact on their organisations this year, marking a 5% increase in this answer over 2024.

title: Billbug espionage group targets government, critical sectors in coordinated Southeast Asia ...
summary: New research from Symantec revealed that the China-linked espionage group Billbug compromised multiple organizations within a single Southeast Asian country. The attacks involved using multiple new custom tools, including loaders, credential stealers, and a reverse SSH tool. The researchers said that among the new tools deployed were two designed to steal credentials from the Chrome web browser. The group also staged an intrusion against a news agency located in another country in Southeast Asia and an air freight organization located in a neighboring country.

title: Identity is under siege as AI and cyber exploits evolve and outpace defenses
summary: At the center of cybersecurity crises is a single, unifying vulnerability: digital identity. Identity attacks now comprise nearly a third of all intrusions, according to IBM. In 2024 alone, IBM recorded an 84 percent spike in emails delivering infostealer malware. With AI-as-a-service available on underground markets, even low-skilled actors can launch sophisticated operations, IBM says. The Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures Program is set to collapse in the coming months, leaving organizations blind to newly discovered flaws.

title: Winners announced: ELSA's second Industry Call strengthens connection between AI ...
summary: ELSA – European Lighthouse on Secure and Safe AI, has finished its second Industry Call. During its call, ELSA looked for applications from SMEs and startups in all business stages and various kinds of research areas. Seven winners have now been selected. They will receive 60,000 € funding and will be supported by ELSA experts over six months. ELSA’s Europe-wide Industry Call strengthens the connection, knowledge exchange, and collaboration between excellent AI and cybersecurity researchers and industry-oriented companies.

title: Volvo Defense at DEFEA 2025: Highly capable solutions for the toughest conditions

title: Terra Security raises $7.5M in Seed round for its agentic AI pen testing solution

Already serving multiple clients, including Fortune 500 companies, Terra will use the funds to advance its platform, expand its AI agents’ capabilities, and grow its customer base.

title: Wang Yi on the Consensus Reached at the 1st Ministerial Meeting of China-Indonesia Joint ...
summary: Wang Yi said that based on the common understandings reached between President Xi Jinping and President Prabowo Subianto, the First Ministerial Meeting of China-Indonesia Joint Foreign and Defense Ministerial Dialogue was held today. This is the first joint foreign and defense ministerial dialogue established by China globally, marking the opening of a new chapter in the strategic mutual trust as well as political and security cooperation. Both sides agreed to uphold the strategic guidance of the heads of state, maintain close high-level exchanges, and firmly support each other's core interests and major concerns.
